column2: Position :   Bolt Torqueing and Tensioning Manager   Job description- The Bolt Torqueing and Tensioning Manager will be responsible for overseeing the department operational aspects, including client interactions, job inquiries, estimates, and the operation and maintenance of both modern and conventional equipment. He / She is responsible for managing all aspects of bolted joint assembly, torquing, and tensioning operations within a mechanical or industrial setting. This role involves overseeing a team of technicians, ensuring compliance with safety standards, optimizing procedures for efficient and effective bolted joint installations, and maintaining equipment used for torquing and tensioning. Aligning with our company's profit margin objectives and ensuring that projects meet profit expectations. Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Technology, or related field (preferred).  A minimum of 12 years experience in Bolt Torquing and Tensioning operations, with at least 6+ years in managerial or supervisory roles.  Certification in bolt torquing and tensioning techniques (e.g., ASME PCC-1, ASME PCC-1- 2019, or equivalent) is a plus.  Proven experience in bolt torquing and tensioning operations, including knowledge of industry standards and best practices.  Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage a team and collaborate with cross-functional teams.  Knowledge of torque and tensioning equipment, tools, and techniques.  Familiarity with safety regulations and procedures in industrial settings.  Attention to detail and a focus on quality and accuracy.  Proven success in lead generation, deal closure, and achieving profit goals.  Proficiency in project management tools and software.  Strong multitasking, prioritization, and stress management skills.  Excellent client-facing and relationship management abilities.  Exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills. Perks and benefits     Basic salary based on Interview performance. Food, Accommodation & transportation provided by company. Job Type - Permanent
column11: Bolt Torqueing, tensioning operations, Tensioning Manager, bolted joint assembly, torqueing, Mechanical, ASME PCC-1

column2: Essential Qualification: BE/Diploma (Elec,Mechatronics,Inst.) Desired Qualification :Any of the essential      Controls. CNC , PLC , ROBOT , Drives , Servo , HMI , IOT , etc , ..      Overall Experience: 6-10 years Related experience:3-6 yrs The project will have Controls Design Lead (CDL), who coordinates all the design aspects of the projects, although the design activities, or its parts, might be actually executed by other persons including outside parties and vendors. The responsibilities of the Control Design lead are: No. Role Responsibility      1. Design lead will be involved from the PSM [preliminary stage meaning ] 2. Design lead will make a site visit along with the PL [ Project Leader ], for evaluating the existing site / equipments /      components / process, etc. or to interact with the customer representatives about the finer aspects of their requirements, or clarification of his understanding.      3. SRS will have to be signed off by the PL.      4. Design lead will understand the mechanical system & Application system requirement      5. Design lead will Complete electrical and control system design as per the concept, wiring diagrams, panel diagrams,      Flow Charts of Operational Sequences CNC & PLC      6. The operating logic, I/O assignments, sequence of operation, error & exception conditions, safety interlocks      7. Design lead will work to develop the CNC/Robot programs, HMI and PLC ladder.      8. Preparation of the DAP drawings as per the DAP checklist specific to project if provided by PL.      9. Design lead will work for detailed BOM, along with target costs, CBOM [Critical Bought Out Material]      10. Design lead will work for release of detailed panel & machine wiring diagrams,      11. Design lead will work for panel manufacturing and assembly drawings will be released at DRM [ Design review meeting]. 12. The CDL will be responsible to review the designs before release himself, or through other competent reviewers, for      correctness and completeness and suitability for application. He will use the following tools, and ensure their compliance 13. Design lead will work for Checklist for verifying general system design guidelines for operating environment, safety,      maintenance and usability 14. To ensure that these are bring complied with, the design will be reviewed through the Application Checklist suitable for      that application. 15. DL is required to proactively support the project in build phase, Testing / Prototyping & Trials of concept, Any Design      modifications & changes for resolving issues at Proving stage. etc. 16. User Requirement Change Requests (UCR), System Change Requests (SCR), Engineering Change Requests (ECR) 17. DL will be responsible for preparing and tracking the micro schedules and sub-milestones in the design activity to      ensure that design timeframes are met. 18. Panel Layouts, Field Wiring Diagrams, Basic User Manual Skeleton of document with Startup / Shutdown /      Programmed Sequences & Cycles, and Diagnostics pages. 19. DL is responsible for arranging design support upto Project Closure, as per the requirements on site, as requested by      PLC Code development Multi PLC capability, AB,Siemens, Mitsubishi, etc,.. Motion control system CNC Gantry GCode software development User interface development Flowchart for application development Design, guide design & assembly engineers

column2: Dura Placements  is looking for Tool Room Manager  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.The Tool Room Manager is responsible for the efficient management, organization, and maintenance of all tools, equipment, and supplies in the tool room. They will ensure that the right tools are available to support manufacturing and maintenance operations, manage tool inventory, coordinate tool repairs and maintenance, and implement safety and efficiency measures within the tool room. Key Responsibilities: Tool Inventory Management: Maintain accurate records of all tools, equipment, and supplies in the tool room. Monitor tool usage and reorder as necessary to ensure availability. Implement a system for tool identification and tracking. Tool Maintenance and Repairs: Schedule and coordinate routine maintenance and repairs for tools and equipment. Work closely with external suppliers and repair vendors. Ensure all tools are in good working condition and comply with safety standards. Tool Distribution and Control: Issue tools to authorized personnel and track their usage. Implement a check-in/check-out system to prevent loss or theft of tools. Enforce tool return policies and handle any discrepancies. Safety Compliance: Ensure that all tools meet safety standards and are properly calibrated. Promote safe handling and storage of tools. Conduct safety audits and address any safety issues promptly. Inventory Procurement: Collaborate with procurement and purchasing departments to order new tools and supplies. Evaluate supplier performance and negotiate contracts for tool procurement. Cost Control: Monitor tool-related expenses and identify cost-saving opportunities. Optimize inventory levels to minimize waste and overstocking. Team Management: Lead and supervise tool room staff, if applicable. Provide training and support to team members. Schedule work shifts to ensure tool room coverage.

The  Tool Maintenance Manager  plays a pivotal role within the manufacturing industry, ensuring that all operational equipment and facilities are functioning efficiently and safely. ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Stamping and Forming Tool Maintenance : Develop specialized maintenance plans for stamping and forming tools. Regularly inspect dies, molds, and other tooling components. Address wear, damage, and performance issues promptly. Tool Corrections and Optimization : Investigate tool-related problems during stamping and forming processes. Collaborate with engineers to correct issues and optimize tool performance. Ensure tools meet quality standards for precision and efficiency. Maintenance Scheduling and Downtime Reduction : Create schedules for stamping tool maintenance. Prioritize critical maintenance tasks to minimize production disruptions. Optimize downtime by coordinating maintenance during non-production hours. Team Leadership and Training : Supervise the maintenance team, emphasizing stamping expertise. Train staff on stamping tool handling, maintenance, and safety protocols. Collaboration and Communication : Work closely with production and quality teams. Communicate tool-related updates and improvements. PREFERRED CANDIDATE PROFILE: Educational Background : A  Diploma's  or  Bachelors degree  in mechanical engineering or a related field is typically required. Additional certifications related to maintenance (e.g., CMRP) are advantageous. Experience : Minimum of five years  of experience in maintenance management, preferably in the manufacturing industry. Specific expertise  in  stamping and forming tools  is highly desirable. Good experience and understanding of design of tools for sheet metal stamping. Skills and Competencies : Technical Knowledge : Proficiency in understanding and maintaining various types of tools, including dies, molds, and stamping equipment. Problem-Solving : Ability to troubleshoot tool-related issues and implement corrective actions. Leadership : Experience in supervising maintenance teams and providing guidance. Communication : Effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and clear communication of tool-related updates. Attitude and Adaptability : Detail-Oriented : Meticulous attention to tool maintenance schedules and quality standards. Adaptability : Willingness to learn and adapt to evolving technologies and industry practices. Safety Focus : Prioritization of safety protocols during maintenance activities. PERKS & BENEFITS: Educational Assistance For Kids Health Insurance Travel Claims Canteen Bus - planned in near future.
column11: Press Tools, Tool Maintenance, Sheet Metal, Stamping, Tool Engineering, Press Shop, Press Tool Maintenance, Tool Trials, Press Tool Design, Tool Room, Die Maintenance

column2: We are currently looking for a Tool Crib / Room Manager, Locomotive at our project site in Dahod     This position will report to the Manufacturing Manager           The job responsibilities of the Tool Crib / Room Manager, Locomotive include (but not limited to):       Maintains a detailed inventory of Tools, Equipment etc. and ensure their proper storage and maintenance.     Supports Production / Manufacturing to manage and guarantee on-time availability of Tools to ensure continuous production and increase of OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness).     Involve in the Installation and Commissioning of New tools, including conducting periodic quality checks to ensure that the finished product meets the required specifications.     Provides technical advice and support on all aspects of Tools design, Manufacturing and estimation.     Responsible for Inventory control of Tools, Equipment Consumables in an orderly and accessible manner.     Monitors controls Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and conducts timely Risk Assessments of the Processes and Tasks for Tool Room.     Works closely with Production to identify and troubleshoot tooling issues, implementing solutions to maximize the efficiency, minimize scrap and downtime.     Ensures that all Jigs, Fixtures and Tools are properly maintained and repaired as per defined Preventive Maintenance schedules.     Develops Continual Improvement plans and Spares Management of the New / Existing tools.     Maintains accurate records of all tooling maintenance and repairs (with the focus on MTBF, MTTR, Tools History Card, Monthly Performance data, SMED etc.).     Controls the minimum / maximum levels for all the Tools, Hand Tools etc.     Works with Quality to manage Tooling requirements, documentation etc. as specified in the Quality Systems.     Coordinates with Vendors for the Procurement of New tools or the Repair of existing ones.     Assists in budget preparation for the Tool room operations and monitors the expenditures.     Monitors calibration of tools Co-ordinates for recalibration.           Use your skills to move the world forward.         Graduate in Industrial Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or related field required.       Should have at least 4-6 years??experience in handling tool room of mid. or Heavy engineering unit. Experience in rolling stock is preferred.     Ability to read and interpret standards, blueprints, layouts, drawings, 2D / 3D models, and wiring diagrams.     Advanced knowledge of Assembly Jigs, fixtures, hand tools, their designs, uses, repair and maintenance.     Well-versed in working with the Microsoft Office suite, AutoCAD.     A self-motivator with a results-driven approach having effective technical and inter-personal skills.     Should be proficient in English and Hindi. Fluency in Gujarati is an added benefit
